page.title: 14AN AFTERNOON STROLL.
page.content: Just three miles from{Chichester}a chalky,flinty path leads onto the Downs from a car park near{West Stoke. Waving fields of barley, in which poppies raise their heads, flank the path. { Kingley Vale}nature trail lies straight ahead, but turn right and you get a beautiful view across fields to the{Trundle,}rising to over 600ft. From the top you get a wonderful view of the South Coast from the{Isle of} {Wight}to{Bognor Regis.}The harbours and creeks are clearly visible. You can see the green copper roof of Chichester cathedral, the cliffs at {Bembridge}and{Hayling Island. }
